us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame

Class FrameLineSegment3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.FrameLineSegment3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineSegment3DBasics, LineSegment3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<FrameLineSegment3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<FrameLineSegment3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameLineSegment3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<FrameLineSegment3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable, FixedFrameLineSegment3DBasics, FrameChangeable, FrameLineSegment3DBasics, FrameLineSegment3DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder

    public class FrameLineSegment3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements FrameLineSegment3DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameLineSegment3D>
    FrameLineSegment3D is a 3D line segment expressed in a given reference frame.

    In addition to representing a LineSegment3DBasics, a ReferenceFrame is associated to a FrameLineSegment3D. This allows, for instance, to enforce, at runtime, that operations on line segments occur in the same coordinate system. Also, via the method FrameChangeable.changeFrame(ReferenceFrame), one can easily calculates the value of a point in different reference frames.

    Because a FrameLineSegment3D extends LineSegment3DBasics, it is compatible with methods only requiring LineSegment3DBasics. However, these methods do NOT assert that the operation occur in the proper coordinate system. Use this feature carefully and always prefer using methods requiring FrameLineSegment3D.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FrameLineSegment3D()
      Default constructor that initializes both endpoints of this line segment to zero and its reference frame to ReferenceFrame.getWorldFrame().
      FrameLineSegment3D(FrameLineSegment3DReadOnly other)
      Creates a new line segment and initializes it to be same as the given line segment.
      FrameLineSegment3D(LineSegment3DReadOnly lineSegment3DReadOnly)
      Creates a new line segment and initializes it to be same as the given line segment.
      FrameLineSegment3D(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame)
      Default constructor that initializes both endpoints of this line segment to zero and its reference frame to referenceFrame.
      FrameLineSegment3D(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame, LineSegment3DReadOnly lineSegment3DReadOnly)
      Creates a new line segment and initializes it to be same as the given line segment.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(FrameLineSegment3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on both endpoints if this line segment is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.

        If the two line segments have different frames, this method returns false.

        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<FrameLineSegment3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments are equal and are expressed in the same reference frame, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(FrameLineSegment3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two lines are geometrically similar.

        Two lines are considered geometrically equal is they are collinear, pointing toward the same or opposite direction.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<FrameLineSegment3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if this and other are not expressed in the same reference frame.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Tests if the given object's class is the same as this, in which case the method returns FrameLineSegment3DReadOnly.equals(FrameLineSegment3DReadOnly), it returns false otherwise.

        If the two line segments have different frames, this method returns false.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        object - the object to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments are exactly equal component-wise and are expressed in the same reference frame, false otherwise.
